availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Frances S. Hickman on May 1835. Married to Sarah L. Watson on October 1, 1840. Father of John C. Watson, Jane S. Watson, George C. Watson, and Anna Watson. Member of the Whig Party Central Committee of Kentucky's Eight Congressional District in 1853. Physician in Frankfort in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 105; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 16; "The August Election," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), July 18, 1853, p. 2; Find A Grave, "Dr. Edward Howe Watson (1814-1868)," Memorial #60201239, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=60201239&ref=acom (accessed June 1, 2017).
